page.title: 18SOCIAL CONCERNS - LIFESTYLES
page.content: Both{Harmston}and{Coleby}have changed from agricultural communities to dormitory villages. Public transport no longer runs through the heart of these villages but along the main road 0.25 mile away. Both Post Offices are unable to compete with supermarkets and are threatened by increased postal benefit and pension options. District firms make Â£10_15 call out charges. A mobile bank is available in the district three times a week. Local voluntary organisations and the public give commendable support to the Harmston Hall Hospital. Villagers and visitors enjoy the walking facilities of Ermine Street,the Viking Way and the pleasant wide grass verges. In 1979{Coleby}won the county Best Kept Small Village award for the second time.
